data.title: Board & Leadership
data.meta_description: Our board & leaders are diverse professionals with well-established business, community, & family roots throughout Texas & Mexico. Learn more about our vision.
data.text:
Business Leadership

Jeff Sinnott serves as President and Chief Executive Officer and is a member of the Board of Directors of Vantage Bank. He joined Vantage Bank in 2018 as Chief Operations, Technology and ERM Officer where he led a complete overhaul of the bank’s operations and technology divisions, emphasizing an enhanced, omni-channel customer experience.

Mr. Sinnott has been in the commercial banking and technology fields for the past 25 years, focusing on innovation and transformation. He began his career in Charlotte, NC as a software engineer working on the Model Banking Program at Bank of America. He has since overseen large-scale technology and operations initiatives at numerous banks and spent a portion of his career leading global software initiatives in the consumer goods industry, focusing on product design, development and deployment. Some of the major firms where Mr. Sinnott led these initiatives include PepsiCo, Heinz, Walmart, and Danone. He returned to banking in 2003 when he joined Summit Bank, N.A. as their Chief Information Officer. In 2007, Sinnott joined Southwest Bank in Fort Worth as Chief Operations Officer where, along with the Operations and Technology divisions, he led the Treasury Management sales team. Jeff brought his expertise to Vantage Bank in the fall of 2018 and, in a short period of time, has made an extraordinary impact on the way the bank delivers products and services to our customers.

Mr. Sinnott graduated from Texas A&M University in 1994, earning a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analysis/Management Information Systems. He also graduated with honors from the Graduate School of Banking in Colorado in 2006.

Business Leadership

Randy is currently serving as the Chief Credit Officer of Vantage Bank. In this position, he is responsible for the management and strategic direction of the credit department, appraisal group, loan review team, and special asset division. He is a tenured credit officer with over 20 years of operational, sales, credit, and risk experience in banking and corporate lending. Prior to joining Vantage Bank, Randy was the Chief Credit Officer at Southwest Bank in Fort Worth, Texas. His corporate experience includes senior management and executive positions at Equify Financial, Equify Real Estate, F&M Bank Corp and General Electric Capital Corporation.

Randy holds an undergraduate Business Degree from the University of North Texas.

Business Leadership

Rafael (Rafa) G. Garza serves as Executive Vice Chairman of the Board of VBT Financial Corporation and its subsidiary, Vantage Bank Texas. He is a Founder and was Managing Director of Bravo Equity Partners, a private equity firm based in Fort Worth, Texas focused on providing capital to middle-market companies in the US and Mexico. Mr. Garza was involved in Bravo’s portfolio companies in the banking and financial services, retail, food and educational services sectors.

Prior to founding Bravo, Mr. Garza served as Country Manager and Director of Ernst & Young’s Mexico City-based Corporate Finance Practice. Mr. Garza has also worked with Ernst & Young clients in U.S. and Mexico including forming and leading a Dallas based team which specialized in corporate finance, financial advisory and mergers & acquisitions. Mr. Garza’s experience includes over 30 years of advising a significant number of U.S. and Mexico based companies with capital and strategic initiatives including corporate finance transactions, buyouts, recapitalizations and assisting high-growth companies.

Mr. Garza serves on the Board of Directors of Atmos Energy Corporation, the largest non-integrated natural gas utility in the United States and member of S&P 500. He serves in the Audit and Governance Committees.

Mr. Garza was born and raised in McAllen, Texas. He earned his Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration; Accounting from Texas Christian University. Mr. Garza is fluent in Spanish.

Business Leadership

Mr. Sinnott serves as President and Chief Executive Officer and is a member of the Board of Directors of Vantage Bank. Sinnott joined Vantage Bank in 2018 as Chief Operations, Technology and ERM Officer where he led a complete overhaul of the bank’s operations and technology divisions, emphasizing an enhanced, omni-channel customer experience.

Business Leadership

Since 1999, Michael Kiolbassa has been the President of Kiolbassa Provision Company. After a short career as an analyst in banking, Michael started at the company as a Plant Manager in 1987. By 1989, he had moved into the sales department where he began to focus on developing the Kiolbassa brand and marketing the company. Under his leadership, Kiolbassa Provision Company has become the number one selling premium smoked sausage brand in Texas and one of the fastest growing smoked meat brands in the country and is distributed in all 50 states, Mexico and Puerto Rico. Michael and the Kiolbassa Family have been recognized by the Texas Historical Commission as a Texas Business Treasure.

Mr. Kiolbassa is a native of San Antonio. He graduated from Alamo Heights High School in 1980 and earned his Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration from Southern Methodist University in 1984.

Business Leadership

Robert (Bob) Morehead holds various executive management positions, including President, and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of multiple entities controlled by Mayfair Properties and Rioco. In those capacities, Mr. Morehead manages real estate investments, real estate development, property management, real estate brokerage, private equity investments, and venture capital investment activities. Additionally he oversees accounting, financial reporting, and lending activities for those entities.

He currently sits on the Board of Directors of South Texas GMC, South Texas Financial Services and Mayfair Private Trust Company. He is an Advisory Director for Petroleum Solutions, Edwards Abstract & Title and JBWW-MG. In the past, he has served as a Director of Medina Bankshares, Inc., and as President & CEO of CTM Credit Union.

Mr. Morehead holds both a Bachelor’s and Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the University of Texas-RGV.

Business Leadership

Tyler Stone is currently the Chief Investment Officer for Mayfair Private Trust Company and Rioco Partners, Ltd. where he oversees the private equity portfolio investments of the firm including sourcing, structuring, oversight, and disposition of the investments. Mr. Stone joined Mayfair in 2012 after working in Deloitte’s Transaction Advisory practice in Dallas, primarily providing business valuation and bankruptcy/reorganization services. In addition, he manages commercial real estate projects and beneficiary communications.

Mr. Stone has an MBA from Southern Methodist University and a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Texas A&M University. He is also a graduate of the Leadership McAllen Class XXXIII.

Mr. Stone currently lives in McAllen with his wife and 3 children.

Business Leadership

Bill Wilson is an experienced leader in the banking industry, having managed Commercial, Business Banking, Retail, Special Assets, Real Estate, and Small Business Administration business segments throughout his career. Before retiring from Texas Capital Bank in September 2020, Wilson served 3 years as Executive Managing Director of several business units in Austin and as President and then Chairman of the Houston Region for 8 years. Prior to joining Texas Capital Bank, Wilson served as the Central Texas Region President for Wachovia Bank from 2004 to 2009. Based in Austin, Wilson was responsible for Wachovia’s operations in Austin and San Antonio. In total, Wilson has more than 40 years of banking experience, including 20 years with Bank of America and its predecessor banks. He graduated from Texas Military Institute in San Antonio and obtained a BBA degree in Finance from Southern Methodist University.

Mr. Wilson is a native of Lockhart, Texas. He currently resides near Fredericksburg with his wife and has three children and five grandchildren.
